review_blob: Light hazy yellow pour with a white fluffy head. The nose has lots of hops both lightly fruity, herbal and earthy. The taste is mostly sharper resinous hops with a ballancing malty undertone. Aftertaste is slightly bitter, texture is medium light with a soft carbonation. Ticks the boxes that needs to be ticked when in the mood for an ipa - good but probably not great.

Quick notes from the HF tap takeover @mikkellerbar Aarhus. Nose has compact citra, danky and semi sweet hoppy notes.
The taste is sweet with mouthcoating hops and a perfectly bitter finish. Mellow hoppy and juicy aftertaste. Really great.

Hazy dark straw colour with a semi dense white head. Nose is sweet and bitter at the same time. Very tropical and fruity. Taste has full flavours but still feels light. Full on herbal, dank hops. Lightly bitter aftertaste. Very long lasting aftertaste. Thought this was great

Teaish hops on the nose, juicy colombus, light herbal dankness. Taste is light but somehow packed with hops. mouthfeel is light. Aftertaste is fairly bitter. Nice display of the colombus but somehow lacks the ballance of other HF hoppy brews. Still very very good.

Tap @mikkellerbar Aarhus. Light hazy golden orange pour. The nose is light tropical and lightly dank. The taste is light too - hoppy and pretty damn fresh and rich for an apa. Soft prisklasser mouthfeel and fairly fruity. Bitterness only in the aftertaste. Light mouthfeel medium carbonation. Great apa

Hazy light orange pour. The nose has soft piney hops and lots of them. 
On the palate the soft hoppy notes are back, with more light pine sap and soft fruits. Perfect mouthfeel. Aftertaste is perfectly piney rich with good bitterness. Well made AF

The nose hos all kinds of dark, warm notes.. Dades, prunes, figs and boozy caramel. Christmas chocolate and all the spices of the xmas season. Everything barrel aged of course. The taste is sweet with spicy caramel, vanilla and boozy fudge. The aftertaste is sweet, leathery and oaky. The Texture is medium rich, oily and with low carbonation.

N: coffee, dark chocolate, hints of doughnuts. Still prefer a fresh box of krispy kreme though. Sweet licorice, dark brownie and light sultanas.
T: light smoky malts. Licorice. Pretty roasted with a fairly high bitterness.
The aftertaste is drying with big roasted malt. Texture is medium rich with a lasting aftertaste.

The nose has burgundy lemony pinot and sweet oak. 
The taste is light oud bruin, tannic oak and ligh tart fruit. Light cherry and raspberry. The aftertaste is dry, fruity and bitter. Mouthfeel is light with medium carbonation.

The most clean passionfruit Ive come across in any aroma. Tastes follows suit with big soft passionfruit and mineral gose characteristics. Really very good fruity gose. Lingering dry aftertaste with hints of salt and lactic tartness.

Such a huge head on this one.. Take your time pouring. First part pours clear golden straw then comes the yeasty stuff. Nose: flowery and zesty saison nose. A little leather a little flinty riesling. Taste: same thing but with added spice and farmhouse yeast. Slightly sour finish and a long flowery aftertaste. Nice spring beer.

Tap @basementbeerbar Another example of Brewski surprising me in a very positive way. Nose has tropical fruits, mango, and a sour saison like quality. That farmhouse yeast. The taste is extremely refreshing and sour. So much lemon and lime here along with the flowery yeasty flavours. I love how sour this is for a saison. Tart, sour and fresh aftertaste. Looooove me some Brewski.

I love this beer. Smells like coffee and reeses peanutbutter cups. The taste is rich with an intense reeses browniemix flavour. Big sweetness but sufficient bitterness to ballance it all out. Super sweet espresso aftertaste. Texture is full and oily with good carbonation.
beer_name: Omnipollo / Buxton Yellow Belly Peanut Butter Biscuit Stout

review_blob:
Tap @warpigs and bottle @ my house.
N: herbal, halfdank, semi fruity nose. 
T: highly drinkable, full flavoured, good hoppy bitterness, medium full body. Lovely fruity and hoppy aftertaste. Everything works well here.

Tap @Warpigs N: fruity mango nose. Lovely. Taste is fresh and hides the alcohol nicely. Would have prefered a lower abv but beggars cant be choosers.. Great crispy, full hoppy beer with a solid malt base. Aftertaste is oily resinous, slightly bitter and with hints of caramel malts. Liked it much better from tap than from a 1 day old growler.

Pours clear dark red/brownish with a small film of foam. N: pretty simple blackberry juice and something mineral. T: mineral, lightly tart blackberry flavour. Blackberries can be much more acidic from the stem but this is only lightly acidic. Very pleassant though. Johannesbiersaft. Dry berry aftertaste. Very good and an easy drinker.

Black pour, nice trick tan head. N: roasted malts. Rally old school well made stout. Slightly fruity, dry licorice and dark chocolate. T: wow! Creamy mouthfeel initially.! Tastes great. Full dessert style.. Dark chocolate cake, roasted malts. Aftertaste is lingering. Good stuff.
beer_name: Cigar City Marshal Zhukovs Imperial Stout

review_blob: Pours hazy pale straw. N: yoghurt passionfruit nose. Little tart action but mostly light guava and pasionfruit nose. T: tropical tartness. Slightly lactic, very guava.. Aftertaste is light tropical flavours, no sour fruit. Mouthfeel is medium with soft carbonation. Reminds me a little of Perennial pineapple kumquat berliner weisse just a tad more rich and full flavoured. I like this a lot. Thanks to @beercation for suggesting this

Bottle@Himmeriget N: damn! Bounty bar, boozy brownie batter. All kinds of chocolate and spicy vanilla oak. Legend! T: tastes even better... How is that possible. Sweet and spicy fudge, pepper heat and boozy heat. Candy goodness.. Naughty stuff this.. Aftertaste is hot and boozy for a bit but turns sweet and chocolaty and lingers forever. Body is full/creamy carbonation is soft. This is what you hope for - this is what you dream about.
beer_name: Westbrook Mexican Cake Imperial Stout - Apple Brandy Barrel

review_blob: Tap @mikkellerbar Viktoriagade. Nice expression of the spontan series. Semi clear orange, fresh and zesty nose. Taste is dry with sour fruity hints. Aftertaste is drying only slightly bitter. Clean!
UPDATED: APR 8, 2016

Pours hazy deep straw with a frothy white head. N: loving this full aroma saison! Lots of flowers, hay and citrus plus a little sour character.. T: really takes ownership of the palate, and I just drank mocha wednesday and bcbs.. Dry yellow winegum, mellow lemon and in lack of words, just everything you want in a saison... Dry, rich aftertaste. One of the best if not the best saison Ive had.
beer_name: Sante Adairius / Triple Rock Cellarman Barrel-Aged Saison

review_blob: Pours pitch black with a creamy tan head. N: perfumed oak and coffee, licorice and roasted malts. T: sweet licorice, roasted malts, bourbon vanilla - just sweet, rich and big. Lots of spices dont know which. Aftertaste is big in bourbon and big on sweet vanilled oak. Licorice again in sweet liquid form. The alc shines through but ads a different layer of complexity. Love this
beer_name: Hangar 24 Barrel Roll No. 03: Pugachevs Cobra - Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout

review_blob: Pours dark brown with a beige head. N: Intense caramel, spicy oak and a hint of leather and some hops too. T: Spicy barley wine nose. Full flavoured! Lots of both caramel and roasted malts, heat from the abv, really good stuff. Medium to full mouthfeel. Dry bourbon oak, prunes and coffee in the aftertaste. Like this lots.
beer_name: Lervig Brewers Reserve Barley Wine Aged in Bourbon Barrels (13%)

review_blob: Pours almost clear copper with an uneaven light beige lasting head. N: chewinggum hops, hints of brett but mostly light fruity hops - juicy fruit. T: More hoppy than bretty, hoppy farmhouse feel with a full hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Finishes dry and fresh. A very nice, easy drinking, hoppy and only slightly tart brew from the good peeps at Surly.

Pours black with a thin layer of dark foam. N: light roasted coffee, chocolate, spicy grains or licorice, hints of coconut but really only hints. 
T: Sweet, mellow roasted malts, The sugary last drops of a double shot of espresso plus sugar, plus a few grains of fresh vanilla. Really creamy, oily mouthfeel. Aftertaste is rounded and does not get too bitter, rather leaning more towards dark caramel. Great!

Blurred notes... Pours semi clear pale straw with a small white head. N: your typical gose sour nose with a nice dose of pineapple juice. Taste is light as is the mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Finishes drying with a slightly salty and zesty lemony twist. Light, easy drinker.

Semi hazy light orange with a white head. N: soft hoppy nose, some hop bitterness/freshness but mostly soft fruits. T: Same note as above. Soft is key here as there are very little of the usual piny hop coming forth. Soft tropical juice. Pleassant slightly bitter aftertaste.

Pours hazy hazy pale yellow. N: soft mango/papaya T: mellow all the way with no real fresh og bitter hops. Finishes mellow, non bitter, non hoppy. Not the usual IPA for sure. The alc is well hidden though..

Pours dark blackish brown. Beige head. N: peppers, chocolate, coffee T: same thing with added chili and vanilla. Soft chocolate but kinda spicy in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Mexican cake times 1.5.. Make sense? 
Thanks @beercation for this spicy beast.

2016 bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with a dark beige lasting (small) head. N: a wee bit peppery.. But not in the bad infected coffee stout way. Sweetness but not much bourbon at all. Rather an espresso roast and hoisin sauce thing.. Sweet roasted malts - Maybe a little soy sauce. T: same thing... Pretty much the excact same thing in the taste, the hoisin, espresso roast, soy, everything plus a little boozy addition. I dont see the resemblance to BT here. This is no little brother. This is a weird cousin. Not bad at all, but not as good as I had hoped. Nice soft, fat mouthfeel. Long lingering aftertaste. (Post Scriptum - time really helps this one.. Time and warmth)
beer_name: The Bruery So Happens Its Tuesday

review_blob: 2016 bottle. Pours a dense clearish dark brown with a brown semi dense head that lasts a good bit. N: Very reminiscent of bcbs and thats a good thing if you ask me. Big sweet bourbon and oak spice, balsamico, chocolate cake and licorice. T: big bold flavours here. The barrel character is big with a bold sweet and spicy middle, ending in a mouthcoating dessertlike destilled brownie batter, some bitterness and a boozy Hello there in the finish.. Medium mouthfeel. Low to medium carbonation. Love this! Huge thanks to @beercation for this

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: N: prunes, charamel, even some hops but mostly big beautiful oak character. Not the sweet spirity kind but fat and fruity and yeasty banana bonbons. Dark fruits galore. T: dark sugars and oaky tanins. Clear barleywine caramel.. Mouthfeel is oily and with low carb. Great fruity aftertaste with a semi hot and sweet Finnish

N: restrained bourbon. Licorice and smoked malt. Dark or maybe burnt chocolate cake. Thinish mouthfeel initially. T: Again restrained flavours mostly on roasted and dark chocolate flavours. Bitter and roasted aftertaste

Black with a small creamy beige head. Truly a fusion of styles.. This has the mouthfeel of a creamy stout, the fullness in flavour and also the fruity middle of the ipa. This is ballanced and just works nicely. Best black ipa Ive had.
beer_name: To l Black Malts & Body Salts Black Coffee IIPA

review_blob: Pours very dark brownish clear with a tan somewhat frothy head. Nose: getting the nutmeg pretty clear, licorice, dark chocolate and coffee and hints of bourbon. The nutmeg ads a funky parfumed spicy twist. Rich taste with mostly roasted malts, bourbon wood and dark chocolate christmas cake coming through. Sweet, spicy lightly boozy. Body is medium thick with medium soft carbonation. Aftertaste is spicy and sweet with roast malts, wet wood, coffee grounds and chocolate - lingering bourbon finish

Pours a hazy light brown orange with a one finger white fizzy head. The nose has a light farmhouse smell with restrained, mineral fruit - plum, unripe apricot. Taste is light with mildly tart fruit, again the light plum comes through. Some yeasty notes along with some slight yoghurt action. Easy drinker, but not too much character I think. Mouthfeel is medium light with a pleassant lively carbonation.

Pours a translucent dark brown with a beige head. Nose has sweet pecan, maple and dark chokolate. Everything is light though.. The taste is light also, with lightly roasted malt, sweet but light maple and dark caramel. The body is light and does not really carry the dessert-like flavours too well. An easy drinker.. Lacks a little omph!
beer_name: High Water Sugaree Maple Bourbon Pecan Pie

review_blob: Very pale straw colour with a fizzy head. Yeasty and lemony notes on the nose, some earthy clay. Tastes corresponds to the nose. Light fresh, yeasty lightly tart farmhouse ale. Not too much fruit at all. Lively mouthfeel , light body. Refreshing though and an easy drinker.

Pours a clear light copper with a white head. 7 day fresh! Nose is pretty packed with well rounded hops, both the danky green notes and fruity ones are here. Very good nose. The taste is well ballanced with a solid malt base but this fresh, the hops shine brightest. Again fruity, piney. Spicy herbal hops. A light to medium carbonation, medium mouthfeel and a round only lightly bitter aftertaste. Good stuff. Still think Todd the axeman comes out on top.

Pours dark reddish brown with a light yellowish head. Nose is dominantly mineral and fruity. Citric but with some vanilled oaky notes. Taste is pretty stoney, mineral with plums and dark fruits - a little leather and finished with dine oak tanins as well. Body is light with a full frizzy carbonation. First go at Wicked Weed.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016

Pours byrgundy deep pink or ruby red with no head. On the nose I get the sweetest and richest raspberries emaginable. Sour, ripe garden raspberries made into jam, small hints of something salty, light whifs of forrest berry yoghurt and of course bretty underlying lambic. One of the nicest and fullest fruit noses of any beer Ive come across. Intense fruityness in the taste with a good sour kick. All in all packing a helluva punch, ballanced by perfect oak. Full almost oily mouthfeel. The aftertaste lingers and in the same direction as the taste. Intensely fruity, intensely sour. Masterpiece!

Almost clear dark golden with a small white head. Nose is citrussy with sour a slight lacto feel. Taste is citrussy fresh again with a sour kick. Very fresh and quaffable. Didnt pick up much hops in the nose or taste. Refreshing stuff though.

Pours hazy yellow with a semi dense white head. Yellow fruit nose with crisp hops too. The taste is again a duet of both citrussy, yellow fruits and hops. Both a fruity (lime) and a hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Fresh from tap at the local watering hole. Pretty happy about that but I still prefer mangofeber over this.

Light hazy golden pour with a white head. Nice hoppy, fairly fruity aromas. Mostly green and citrussy but with whifs of tropical fruit also. Taste is pretty light but with bitter hoppenes. For such a light beer it packs a good flavour punch but I also get a good amount of malty undertones, which for this lil drinker is a minus. No hating though - hence the above average score. Good session brew.

Pours a clear copper color with a semi frothy white head. The nose has lacto sour fruityness going on, mostly on sour apple. Hints of fermenting hay and citrus. The taste is pretty sour with the lactic sensation coming through in a big way. The aftertaste is mouthsmackingly zesty again with the yoghurty sour apples coming through. Mouthfeel is oily with medium carbonation.
Liked it lots.
beer_name: Bruery Terreux Sour in the Rye

review_blob: Pours hazy yellow straw with a small white head. Soft citra nose... along with a slight malty aroma. The taste has citrussy hops initially leading to a zesty sharp finish. Mouthfeel is medium with a fairly soft carbonation. Finish is lightly drying. Lovely stuff.

Aromas of caramel, bread, banana, malts, slight hoppy spicy character but mainly big malts, raisins and barrel. Taste is full with big dark fruits, grains and hints of boozy barrel. Very rounded. Sweet but not too much. A slow sipper. Lovely big barley wine with a full mouthfeel and soft carbonation.
beer_name: AleSmith Old Numbskull - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: Pours cloudy straw with a ros hue. The head is just a thin white film. Nose has clay notes, wild stradberry, hops intertwining in an interesting way. Strawberry yoghurt notes coming through. Liking the nose - interesting. The taste again has a funny mineral earthy taste. I get only hints of berry and a good dose of the tropical hop flavour. Aftertaste is pretty full but never getting too bitter. Mineral, lactic and slightly hoppy. Mouthfeel suits the beer fine. Medium carbonation. Would really like to try more hoppy stuff from tired hands. Im all over Omnipollo too. Skl!
